introduction:
All disease begins in the gut. - Hippocrates.

If you wake up with a heavy stomach, rely on antacids, or plan your day around bathroom visits, your foundation of health is shaky. The digestive system is not just a food pipe; it is your 'Second Brain'. Imbalances here lead to anxiety, skin issues, autoimmune diseases, and chronic fatigue.

Our Digestive Disorder Treatment focuses on the 4 R's: Remove (toxins), Replace (enzymes), Reinoculate (good bacteria), and Repair (gut lining). We successfully treat conditions like IBS (Irritable Bowel Syndrome), GERD (Acid Reflux), Chronic Constipation, and Bloating.

sections.title: Understanding the Gut-Brain Axis
sections.content: Have you noticed that when you are stressed, your stomach acts up? This is the Gut-Brain connection. Our treatment protocols address both the physical digestion and the mental stress that often drives conditions like IBS.

sections.title: Natural Therapies for a Happy Gut
sections.content:
1. Hydrotherapy (Hip Bath & Enema)

A Hip Bath diverts blood flow to the pelvic region, relieving constipation and gas. A therapeutic Enema (using water, buttermilk, or oil) helps in washing out old fecal matter that releases toxins into the bloodstream.

2. Mud Packs

Applying a cold mud pack to the abdomen is a miracle cure for Acidity and Ulcers. It absorbs the internal heat (Pitta) and soothes the inflamed lining of the stomach.

3. Diet: The Elimination Protocol

We help you identify food intolerances (gluten, dairy, soy) that might be silently damaging your gut. We then introduce healing foods like bone broth (or vegan equivalent), fermented foods (kanji), and soothing teas.

faq.question: Is an enema safe/habit forming?
faq.answer: Therapeutic enemas given for a short duration during a detox are not habit-forming. They are different from laxatives which irritate the bowel. Enemas mechanically clean the colon.

faq.question: Can you cure severe acidity/GERD?
faq.answer: Yes. By correcting the stomach acid levels (often low acid causes reflux, not high!) and strengthening the esophageal sphincter, we can reverse GERD.
